From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To configure traffic management on the router, use the **service-module apa traffic-management** command in interface configuration mode.

ParaDef.Info: This commmand has no arguments or keywords.

Examples: The following example configures an interface on a Cisco 2851 Integrated Services Router for inline traffic management.
ExtraInfo: To perform traffic management, you enable or disable the flow of packets by configuring the service module interface and the router interface.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Configure the router interface with the **service-module apa traffic-management [monitor | inline]** command.Two traffic management options are available:–![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Monitor—will copy the packet and designate the copy as the one forwarded to the Application Performance Assurance module (NME-APA).–![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Inline—will send the packet to the NME-APA, rather than sending a copy of the packet. After the NME-APA has processes the packet, it sends it back to the router.![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/note.gif)---**Note** ![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Enable only one traffic management option on the router, but not both concurrently.---•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Configure the service module interface with the Application Performance Assurance (APA) graphical user interface (GUI). See the Cisco Application Performance Assurance User Guide on Cisco.com for details.
